description: doc: only trim newlines in tmpltohtml, gofmt progs

messages.text:
On Jan 9, 2012, at 10:40 AM, rsc@golang.org wrote:

> 
> http://codereview.appspot.com/5530048/diff/5001/doc/progs/sortmain.go
> File doc/progs/sortmain.go (right):
> 
> http://codereview.appspot.com/5530048/diff/5001/doc/progs/sortmain.go#newcode9
> doc/progs/sortmain.go:9: "fmt"
> On 2012/01/09 07:15:36, r wrote:
>> this isn't how i'd sort it but i guess that's what gofmt does
> 
> gofmt will leave this alone:
> 
> import (
>    "fmt"
> 
>    "./sort"
> )

+1

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg

On 9 January 2012 17:05, Rob 'Commander' Pike <r@google.com> wrote:
> I still don't understand what this is for.

It's just cleanup that I stumbled upon while adding new code.

It makes this untrue:

"don't gofmt the code in the progs directory. it can screw up the
generated html."

This CL also fixes the indent in several of the generated HTML files,
so it is definitely an improvement on the status quo.

Also gofmt caught this unsorted import group:
 http://codereview.appspot.com/5530048/diff/5001/doc/progs/echo.go

Nothing to get excited about, but it's definitely worth doing.

Andrew

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=705df59d5cca ***

doc: only trim newlines in tmpltohtml, gofmt progs

R=golang-dev, r, r
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5530048

don't gofmt the code in the progs directory. it can screw up the generated html.

-rob

LGTM

but not really

http://codereview.appspot.com/5530048/diff/5001/doc/progs/sortmain.go
File doc/progs/sortmain.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5530048/diff/5001/doc/progs/sortmain.go#newcode9
doc/progs/sortmain.go:9: "fmt"
this isn't how i'd sort it but i guess that's what gofmt does

On 9 January 2012 15:06, Rob 'Commander' Pike <r@google.com> wrote:
> don't gofmt the code in the progs directory. it can screw up the generated html.

Not since I added space trimming to tmpltohtml. This CL includes the
changes to the generated HTML, which are minor changes to the tutorial
only.

Andrew

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, r@google.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, r@google.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

I still don't understand what this is for.

-rob

On Jan 8, 2012, at 10:18 PM, Andrew Gerrand wrote:

> On 9 January 2012 17:05, Rob 'Commander' Pike <r@google.com> wrote:
>> I still don't understand what this is for.
> 
> It's just cleanup that I stumbled upon while adding new code.
> 
> It makes this untrue:
> 
> "don't gofmt the code in the progs directory. it can screw up the
> generated html."

it does not fix this.  if you leave these programs alone then the HTML doesn't go wrong by mistake. if instead you make it a policy to run gofmt on them, it's impossible to verify by machine that the program snippets have not been broken by the edit.

> This CL also fixes the indent in several of the generated HTML files,
> so it is definitely an improvement on the status quo.
> 
> Also gofmt caught this unsorted import group:
> http://codereview.appspot.com/5530048/diff/5001/doc/progs/echo.go

sort them and revert the rest. or don't revert the rest, but understand i have a technical point here.

-rob

http://codereview.appspot.com/5530048/diff/5001/doc/progs/sortmain.go
File doc/progs/sortmain.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5530048/diff/5001/doc/progs/sortmain.go#newcode9
doc/progs/sortmain.go:9: "fmt"
On 2012/01/09 07:15:36, r wrote:
> this isn't how i'd sort it but i guess that's what gofmt does

gofmt will leave this alone:

import (
    "fmt"

    "./sort"
)

Turns out my original trimming change was broken for indented code snippets. This new change has tmpltohtml only trim newlines, giving the expected result.

Sorry for all the churn.

On 9 January 2012 17:22, Rob 'Commander' Pike <r@google.com> wrote:
>
> On Jan 8, 2012, at 10:18 PM, Andrew Gerrand wrote:
>
>> On 9 January 2012 17:05, Rob 'Commander' Pike <r@google.com> wrote:
>>> I still don't understand what this is for.
>>
>> It's just cleanup that I stumbled upon while adding new code.
>>
>> It makes this untrue:
>>
>> "don't gofmt the code in the progs directory. it can screw up the
>> generated html."
>
> it does not fix this.  if you leave these programs alone then the HTML doesn't go wrong by mistake. if instead you make it a policy to run gofmt on them, it's impossible to verify by machine that the program snippets have not been broken by the edit.

If the examples aren't in the standard gofmt format then any time we
run gofix on them we must deal with both spacing changes and semantic
changes. That's what this and the previous CL seek to prevent.

I agree that it should not be policy to update the examples whenever
gofmt affects them, though.

>> This CL also fixes the indent in several of the generated HTML files,
>> so it is definitely an improvement on the status quo.
>>
>> Also gofmt caught this unsorted import group:
>> http://codereview.appspot.com/5530048/diff/5001/doc/progs/echo.go
>
> sort them and revert the rest. or don't revert the rest, but understand i have a technical point here.

I'd prefer not to revert the rest, as this CL corrects indentation
errors I introduced last week in this CL:
  https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=904c12a55d8abee2f1b6e19b34f666403d906b63#

Andrew

subject: code review 5530048: doc: only trim newlines in tmpltohtml, gofmt progs
